intro: Bupleurum falcatum subsp. cernuum, commonly known as the nodding cowbane, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
